Hill's Science Diet Dry Dog Food, Adult, Light for Healthy Weight & Weight Management, 30 lb Bag

byHill's Science Diet
Size: 30 LB BagColor: White Change
Write a review
How are ratings calculated?
To calculate the overall star rating and percentage breakdown by star, we don’t use a simple average. Instead, our system considers things like how recent a review is and if the reviewer bought the item on Amazon. It also analyzes reviews to verify trustworthiness.

Top positive review

All positive reviews›
more-PUGS-please
4.0 out of 5 stars Dog started to refuse to eat it
Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2020
It’s great for dogs dealing with pancreatitis. Some of the issues I had though was the amount of food I was to give in one sitting was more than my dog could handle. With other dogs in the house I couldn’t leave his bowl down, but with frequent reminders to eat he still started losing weight. He seemed to also have issue with how hard the kibble was on his teeth and now he mostly refuses to eat it even with his old fatty food mixed in it. I will have to find a brand he will eat.
Read more
One person found this helpful

Top critical review

All critical reviews›
Jade Eyes Top Contributor: Coloring
1.0 out of 5 stars MY DOG FOOD IS MOVING!
Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2019
I just opened my new bag of Science Diet diet dry dog food and I noticed that the smell was "different" from past shipments.
I started to ladle the dry food into clean coffee containers because I am disabled and cannot carry a 15# dog food bag into my house. I left the lid off the first container and went to fill the second. When I got back with the second container, the first container of food was moving! As I watched, little dark gray millipede type bugs, worms whatever you want to call them, were crawling to the top of the container. (I assume to reach light. But I don't know.) Then I looked at the second container and it was moving also. Then I went to the carport to look at the rest of the bag and there were bugs moving in and around the little disc shaped pieces. I have to say, it was pretty freaky. Maybe because I watched too many sci fi movies that involve bad insects.
I happened to have a container that had some big pieces and some of the tiny pieces that Science Diet used to offer. These were left overs from previous bags and I forgot that I had put the container in the top of the cabinet. Number 1, I was surprised that the food still smelled fresh like the dog food I had gotten in the past. Number 2, THERE WERE NO BUGS! I am not shouting here, I am exclaiming in great surprise because I had filled that container several months ago. Needless to say, I am cancelling my Subscribe and Save order for this product and will start researching another brand. My dog will eat anything I give her. But I will not consciously give her poor quality food.
UPDATE: I didn't cancel my Subscribe & Save in time and received another order. While my best friend and my UPS driver were standing in my kitchen, when heard a strange sound, like bugs crawling. Two bags of Science Diet were sitting on my kitchen floor. I started looking for the creepy sound and discovered it was coming from the bags! The bugs were still alive and well evidently and the sound was so noticeable that everyone was creeped out. Thankfully my driver took the two bags so I wouldn't have to dispose of them. I don't know what happened to quality control on this product. But it is sadly lacking and I am now in search of dog food my picky hound approves of.
Read more
16 people found this helpful

From the United States

Jade Eyes Top Contributor: Coloring
1.0 out of 5 stars MY DOG FOOD IS MOVING!
Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2019
Size: 30 LB BagColor: White Verified Purchase
I just opened my new bag of Science Diet diet dry dog food and I noticed that the smell was "different" from past shipments.
I started to ladle the dry food into clean coffee containers because I am disabled and cannot carry a 15# dog food bag into my house. I left the lid off the first container and went to fill the second. When I got back with the second container, the first container of food was moving! As I watched, little dark gray millipede type bugs, worms whatever you want to call them, were crawling to the top of the container. (I assume to reach light. But I don't know.) Then I looked at the second container and it was moving also. Then I went to the carport to look at the rest of the bag and there were bugs moving in and around the little disc shaped pieces. I have to say, it was pretty freaky. Maybe because I watched too many sci fi movies that involve bad insects.
I happened to have a container that had some big pieces and some of the tiny pieces that Science Diet used to offer. These were left overs from previous bags and I forgot that I had put the container in the top of the cabinet. Number 1, I was surprised that the food still smelled fresh like the dog food I had gotten in the past. Number 2, THERE WERE NO BUGS! I am not shouting here, I am exclaiming in great surprise because I had filled that container several months ago. Needless to say, I am cancelling my Subscribe and Save order for this product and will start researching another brand. My dog will eat anything I give her. But I will not consciously give her poor quality food.
UPDATE: I didn't cancel my Subscribe & Save in time and received another order. While my best friend and my UPS driver were standing in my kitchen, when heard a strange sound, like bugs crawling. Two bags of Science Diet were sitting on my kitchen floor. I started looking for the creepy sound and discovered it was coming from the bags! The bugs were still alive and well evidently and the sound was so noticeable that everyone was creeped out. Thankfully my driver took the two bags so I wouldn't have to dispose of them. I don't know what happened to quality control on this product. But it is sadly lacking and I am now in search of dog food my picky hound approves of.
16 people found this helpful

Michael Moreno
1.0 out of 5 stars Buyer beware! Choking hazard
Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2019
Size: 30 LB BagColor: White Verified Purchase
I have been using Hill’s science diet light for almost 10 yrs for my English Bulldog. It was recommended by my vet for weight control and I have never had any problem whatsoever with it... until now!

Beware if you have a Bully or any breed that likes to inhale food as Bulldogs tend to do. I have always had the “if it ain’t broke.. don’t fix it” mentality. And apparently some “Genius” of this company decided to make the pebbles A LOT SMALLER. Now my bulldog is choking on this food every time he ate! Choked to the point of almost passing out and vomiting! Since the pebbles are about 1/3 the size of before, he is stuffing his mouth with these tiny pebbles and not chewing correctly and the food is getting lodged in his throat. I have always had one of those weighed balls in his bowl to slow him down on eating, but not even that is helping this problem. By the way he NEVER had this problem before in all the years eating science diet until this new bag.

Please be careful if you decide to feed this TRASH to your pet. I will be calling this company soon to complain and see if I can get a refund of some sort and to warn them in case these brainiacs did not know the new marketing strategy might be putting dogs in danger of choking.

The picture I added is the difference between the old version (right) and the new and “improved” according to Hill’s.
15 people found this helpful
Helpful

Shineyshine
5.0 out of 5 stars No more butt stank!
Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2019
Size: 15 LB BagColor: White Verified Purchase
This did the trick fixing my goldendoodle's anal gland problem. Tried those supplements, pumpkin, nothing worked, she constantly had such bad odor from her anal glands. A new vet suggested we try this food for the fiber. Better buy a pooper-scooper while you're at it, this really cleans them out. I was worried she would lose weight on this, she's naturally very svelte, but she hasn't lost, actually gained a couple pounds (43 lbs to 45 lbs)

My dogs have been eating this brand of dog food for over 8 years. I know its probably not the healthiest out there, but it is definitely not unhealthy for them. My dogs have nice soft fur, they are healthy and happy.

Kim
5.0 out of 5 stars A little spendy but quality food.
Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2019
Size: 30 LB BagColor: White Verified Purchase
Our dogs loves this dog food. It was recommended by our veterinarian. The light is the perfect formula to keep our dogs from getting over weight. The down side is it's only recommended by the manufacture to up age 7. They really need to make a light food for dogs over that age who are less active. They used to offer a line like that but stopped making it.
